document_data.name: Dampen
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|7}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Dampen''''' was a useful [[cantrip]] that [[wizard]]s-in-training could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It filled a small area with light fog that made all surfaces moist to the touch and somewhat obscured vision.
document_data.Effects: The target of this spell had to be within {{SI|30|ft|long=yes}} of the caster and no larger than {{SI|1|cu yd|long=yes}}. It permeated the area with a thin cloud of mist that left a residue of water on all surfaces. This had the effect of making objects more difficult to light on fire, but it also degraded parchment and other water-susceptible surfaces. Creatures looking into, out of, or through the area of effect could still see normally but found some details were obscured by the fog.
document_data.Components: The [[somatic component]] of this cantrip was an uplifted hand with wiggling fingers. The [[verbal component]] could be either a hummed tune or a low hooting sound.
